thread.title: The course I charted out for my career made me multi-dimensional: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan
thread.title_full: The course I charted out for my career made me multi-dimensional: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

author: Bolly-Freak
title: The course I charted out for my career made me multi-dimensional: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan
text:
January 24, 2017 Bolly-Freak 11902 reads 29 comments 
Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, who was last seen in the Karan Johar movie Ae Dil Hai Mushkil, spoke to a leading daily about her life and career. Aishwarya mentioned how she planned her career so as to be able to represent India on many global platforms as well. 
Aishwarya said, "Beauty is transient and changes with time. I have always extended beyond a singular dimension. I have't been just a model, actor or title winner. The course I charted out for my career made me multi-dimensional and gave me opportunities to represent India on many global platforms." 
She also spoke about her mother and the influence she has had on her. She said, "My mother Vrinda Rai is the nucleus of my existence. She has greatly moulded me, shaped me, picked me up when I've been down, kept the faith in me and taught me to be the best version of myself that I can be." 
Being the doting mother that she is, Aishwarya also spoke about Aaradhya saying, "She is very sensitive. I think that's a great quality to have." 
Sweet?
